intro: Dresslerella powellii, commonly known as the Powell's lily, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Liliaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is known for its delicate, grass-like foliage and is often found in alpine and subalpine environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
